business.headline: Mahavir Jayanti holiday: Are Sensex and Nifty open for trading today?Stock market holiday: According to the official stock market holiday list, Mahavir Jayanti is one of three holidays in April. The other two are on April 14 for Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti and April 18 for Good Friday.

World's biggest green cargo ship, MSC Turkiye docks at Adani's Vizhinjam PortMSC Turkiye: The vessel is 399.9 metres long, 61.3 metres wide, and has a depth of 33.5 metres. It has the capacity to carry 24,346 twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs), making it one of the largest container ships ever built.

Wall Street surges as Trump hits pause on tariffs, Dow jumps over 2,300 pointsWall Street jumped after President Trump paused new tariffs for 90 days, easing trade worries. Big tech companies like Apple and Nvidia led the gains.
Sensex falls over 350 points, Nifty below 22,500; banking stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 379.73 points to close at 73,847.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.70 points to end at 22,399.15.
From Rajdhani to Vande Bharat: Investor criticises India's lag in train techWhen Rajdhani was launched in 1969, it placed India among Asia's fastest rail nations, second only to Japan.

RBI Governor says US tariff impact on growth bigger worry than inflationThe RBI's rate cut comes at a time when inflation appears to be under control, but economic growth faces risks from global uncertainty after US tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.

RBI rate cut brings relief for borrowers, but banking stocks tumble. Here's whyBanking stocks, especially public sector lenders, took a sharp hit after the rate cut announcement. The Nifty Bank index was down nearly 1%, with major losers including Bank of Baroda, Canara Bank, Punjab National Bank, and SBI.

RBI monetary policy: 6 key takeaways from MPC meetingWith the repo rate cut, borrowing costs for home and personal loans are likely to fall. This would provide a big relief to the homebuyers and could boost the housing market.

RBI MPC meeting: 5 key development reforms you must knowCurrently, UPI payments are mostly capped at Rs 1 lakh for both P2P and P2M. The RBI has suggested that National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) may now review and revise these limits based on evolving user needs.

RBI cuts Repo Rate by 25 points to 6% amid global trade warThe Reserve Bank of India has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6%, potentially leading to lower EMIs for home loans. The RBI has also lowered the GDP forecast for FY26 to 6.5% from the earlier 6.7%. The Monetary Policy Committee unanimously decided to change the stance from neutral to accommodative, hinting at possible further easing. The RBI Governor expressed concerns over global trade uncertainties and their potential impact on inflation and growth.

Cheaper home, auto loan EMIs after RBI rate cut. What it means for youRBI reduces key lending rate to 6%. Lower interest rates are expected to make borrowing cheaper, which can help people buy homes or vehicles more easily.

RBI changes stance from neutral to accommodative: What does it mean?The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Sanjay Malhotra has announced a cut in the repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down from 6.25% to 6%.

entertainment.headline: Supermodel Gigi Hadid reveals how she met her current boyfriend Bradley CooperGigi Hadid opens up in Vogue about how she met Bradley Cooper at a backyard party, sharing insights into their low-key romance and the challenges of dating in the spotlight.

Tracee Ellis Ross wows in burnt orange leather on Good Morning AmericaTracee Ellis Ross stunned on Good Morning America in a burnt orange leather ensemble and Bottega Veneta heels while promoting Black Mirror Season 7 with Rashida Jones, impressing fashion watchers once again.

Beyoncé fans can win concert tickets in Cowboy Carter fashion sweepstakesBeyoncé's Cowboy Carter album has inspired a handmade fashion sweepstakes by MakerPlace. Fans can design outfits for a chance to win concert tickets and $3,000. Entries close this Friday.

Back home, recovering: Tahira Kashyap shares health update after cancer relapseFilmmaker Tahira Kashyap shared a post and updated fans about her health after her breast cancer relapse. She thanked her fans anf followers for their unconditional support.

Dharmendra grooves to dhol beat at son Sunny Deol's Jaat premiere. WatchVeteran actor Dharmendra stole the limelight with his dance at son Sunny Deol's Jaat premiere in Mumbai. The film will release in theatres on April 10.

Dhanush, Mari Selvaraj reunite after four years for 'D56'Dhanush has teamed up with director Mari Selvaraj for his next film. Tentatively titled D56, the movie will be produced by Ishari Ganesh under Vels Films International.

Adolescence 2 in works? Brad Pitt's production in talks with Netflix for sequelNetflix's popular series, Adolescence, is in talks for a second season. The producers are in discussions with the streaming giant for the second season.

Tabu's Haider reunion with 'Laqt-e-jigars' Shahid Kapoor, Vishal BhardwajThe versatile Tabu on Wednesday shared a reunion photo from her meeting with Haider cast, including former co-star Shahid Kapoor and director Vishal Bhardwaj.

Varun Dhawan, Sidharth Malhotra nail Veer Pahariya's viral one-leg dance. WatchVarun Dhawan and Sidharth Malhotra's video from Maddock's success bash has gone viral. The two actors aced Veer Pahariya's viral one-leg dance step.

After Empuraan, Prithviraj Sukumaran starts filming for Nobody. See mahurat picsPrithviraj Sukumaran has finally begun for his next film, titled Nobody, after Empuraan. The actor shared pictures from the mahurat ceremony on social media.

Black Warrant actor Paramvir Singh calls Border 2 co-star Sunny Deol shy, humbleBlack Warrant actor Paramvir Singh Cheema is excited about making his big Bollywood debut with Varun Dhawan and Sunny Deol. The actor was last seen in Chamak 2.

Apoorva Mukhija breaks down in first video since Latent row, says she felt unsafeSocial media sensation Apoorva Mukhija broke down during her first Instagram video after the India's Got Latent controversy. The YouTuber spoke about how she felt unsafe after the row.

Miss watching Shin-chan in summer vacation? Now you can with Our Dinosaur DiaryRelive your childhood memories with the new Shin-chan movie, now playing in Indian cinemas for the first time. After conquering the Japanese box office, Shin-chan: Our Dinosaur Diary was released today, May 9.

MM Keeravani 'privileged' to meet Father of MP3 Karlheinz BrandenburgOscar-winning music composer MM Keeravani recently met Karlheinz Brandenburg, the 'Father of MP3'. Sharing his heartfelt emotions about meeting the legend, he also posted a picture with him.
Manoj Manchu protests outside father Mohan Babu's home: Have no place to goActor Manchu Manoj staged a protest outside his father Mohan Babu's residence in Jalpally, citing that he has nowhere to go.

Mohan Babu, Vishnu Manchu meet Yogi Adityanath, share Kannappa's release dateThe Kannappa team, including Mohan Babu and Vishnu Manchu, visited Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow. They unveiled a poster and the new release date for their film.

30 years after fallout, Rajinikanth reveals why he spoke against JayalalithaaSuperstar Rajinikanth opened up about what influenced his stance against late Tamil Nadu chief minister Jayalalithaa. He described how his critical comment led to the sacking of a minister, which shaped his opposition.

It Ends With Us actor responds to Blake Lively's lawsuit: I was surprisedActor Adam Mondschein has publicly responded to Blake Lively's lawsuit allegations regarding an uncomfortable filming experience in It Ends With Us. Mondschein refuted Lively's claims, stating his perspective of the events.

The Last of Us: A primer to Pedro Pascal series that took TV by stormHBO's The Last of Us, which released in 2023, is a remarkable and unlikely dystopian show that graced modern television. It makes a return next week. Ahead of The Last of Us Season 2 premiere, here is a quick recap of events that unfolded in the first season.

general news.headline: Trump announces 90-day tariff pause, but hikes China levy to 125%US President Donald Trump paused his newly introduced reciprocal tariffs on most countries for 90 days, retaining a reduced 10% rate, while sharply raising tariffs on China to 125%, escalating tensions with Beijing.

Trump's 'buy' tip before tariffs pause raises calls for insider trading probeShortly after markets opened, President Trump took to his Truth Social platform with a pair of upbeat posts. "BE COOL! Everything is going to work out well. The USA will be bigger and better than ever before!" he wrote, followed closely by a more direct appeal to investors: "THIS IS A GREAT TIME TO BUY!!! DJT."

Tariff trap? Trump rewards allies, punishes China in 'art of the deal' strategyWhile the decision to impose across-the-board tariffs triggered panic in financial markets, the Trump administration is now suggesting it was part of a deliberate strategy aimed squarely at isolating China.

Tahawwur Rana on way to India on special flight, to be kept in Tihar jail: SourcesTahawwur Rana is being brought to India after his last-ditch attempt to evade extradition failed as the US Supreme Court justices rejected his application.

Congress at Patel chowk, will it take the revival turn?With an AICC meeting in Gujarat after 64 years, the Congress is trying to make the state a laboratory for its revival. With symbolism and a resolution, the Congress is trying to reclaim the legacy of Sardar Patel, who has been co-opted by the BJP, and used against the Nehru-Gandhi family. Is the Congress's bid too little too late?

Kash Patel removed as acting chief of firearms, alcohol regulatory body: ReportFBI Director Kash Patel has been removed as acting ATF chief and replaced by Army Secretary Daniel Driscoll. The Justice Department says the move wasn't performance-related, but no reason was given.

The vanishing daughters: 10 years of Beti Bachao Beti PadhaoFor ten years, a campaign to save the girl child has occupied walls, been heard in slogans, and spoken as a promise. But behind the posters and promises lies a brutal truth—girls are still being erased before they are born, and those who survive often live in fear.

After 4 days, US markets back in green after Trump's tariff U-turnUS stock markets ended green after a four-day drop following President Donald Trump's announcement to pause tariffs for 90 days on several countries, excepting those on China, which he raised further.

Tariff U-Turn on 90 Countries? Trump says people were getting 'yippy'President Trump hit pause on reciprocal tariffs for 90 days, saying it was a move to ease market nerves. China retaliated with higher tariffs, while the US signalled it would pursue one-on-one talks with its allies.

iPhone may cost three times more, up to Rs 3 lakh, if made in US: ReportIf Apple started making iPhones entirely in the US, the price could shoot up to $3,500(Rs 3 lakh) — that's nearly triple the current cost. Experts say while the goal is to bring jobs back home, it could end up hitting consumers' pockets hard.

Rahul Gandhi vows to 'demolish' wall limiting reservations to 50%Rahul Gandhi vowed to dismantle the 50 per cent cap on reservations for SCs, STs, and OBCs in education and government jobs, citing Telangana's model and calling for a nationwide caste census to ensure greater representation for marginalised communities.

OpenAI countersues Elon Musk, accuses him of smear campaign, harassmentOpenAI cited a pattern of harassment by Elon Musk and asked a federal judge to stop him from any "further unlawful and unfair action" against the company in a court case over the future structure of the firm that helped launch the AI revolution.

Dharmendra grooves to dhol beat at son Sunny Deol's Jaat premiere. WatchVeteran actor Dharmendra stole the limelight with his dance at son Sunny Deol's Jaat premiere in Mumbai. The film will release in theatres on April 10.

Amazon scales back inventory orders from China as tariff tensions escalateAmazon has abruptly cancelled product orders from China and other Asian countries, likely in response to new US tariffs. This has left sellers with extra products that they can't sell easily.
Mother of three converts to marry Class 12 student in third marriage in UPThe woman divorced her second husband and left her three children in his custody to marry a Class 12 student.

Why Beijing isn't blinking in trade war against TrumpIn retaliation for Trump's additional 50 per cent tariff on China, which pushed the total to a staggering 104 per cent, Beijing has announced tariffs of up to 84 per cent on US goods, effective Thursday.

Why pre-marriage counselling needs to be non-negotiable in IndiaNeither men nor women today want to be coerced into an incompatible marriage or, if things go south, simply accept it as their fate. Things are changing, evolving for the better, which is why, now more than ever, pre-marriage counselling should be non-negotiable in India.
Can India close the stealth gap in air defence?It's a race against time to ready a fifth-generation stealth fighter jet and modernise the Indian Air Force as US and China redefine aerial warfare

Back home, recovering: Tahira Kashyap shares health update after cancer relapseFilmmaker Tahira Kashyap shared a post and updated fans about her health after her breast cancer relapse. She thanked her fans anf followers for their unconditional support.

TikTok US deal still on the table, says Trump amid China trade warTrump says the TikTok US deal remains possible despite delays. The divestment deadline is now June 19. Legal and political opposition grows as China signals resistance amid rising trade tensions.

Pamban Bridge revives age-old dream, a direct train from Chennai to ColomboAn India-Sri Lanka direct rail or road link needs just a 25-km-long bridge. The Pamban Bridge, recently inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi, completes a crucial part of a direct train from Chennai to Colombo. Planned by the British, and brought to the drawing table time and again, an India-Lanka rail link would boost both ties and trade.

US to deny visas, green cards over pro-terror, antisemitic social media postsUSCIS will now deny or revoke visas based on social media posts supporting antisemitic terrorism. The immediate policy shift targets online speech and follows recent arrests of pro-Palestinian student activists.

Fresh heatwave likely in Punjab, Haryana next week; rain may lash Delhi todayDelhi, which has been sweltering under heatwave conditions for three days, is likely to witness rain on Thursday and Friday. Meanwhile, a fresh heatwave spell is expected in Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan on April 14 and 15.

Djokovic crashes out of Monte Carlo masters after 2nd straight loss to TabiloNovak Djokovic crashed out of the Monte Carlo Masters following a 3-6, 4-6 loss against unseeded Alejandro Tabilo in the second round on Wednesday. Following his win, Tabilo maintained a remarkable 100% win record over Djokovic.

sports.headline: Robin Uthappa slams Rajasthan Royals for releasing Jos Buttler for mega auctionFormer India cricketer turned commentator Robin Uthappa has slammed Rajasthan Royals (RR) for letting go of Jos Buttler ahead of the mega auction for the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

RR lacked partnerships vs GT, want to win games chasing: Spin bowling coachRajasthan Royals suffered a heavy defeat at the hands of Gujarat Titans, with coach Sairaj Bahutule calling for sharper batting partnerships and adaptability. RR's inability to chase down 218 now poses key questions for their middle-order consistency.

IPL 2025: GT's Sudharsan shows he is ready to be India's next all-format starWith maturity beyond his age, Sai Sudharsan is showing that he has all the tools needed to be India's next all-format star in the coming years. The TN batter has been in fine form for GT this season and is continuing to make fans with his smart gameplay.

Badminton Asia Championship: Sindhu reaches 2nd round with straight-sets winIndia's PV Sindhu made it to the second round of the Badminton Asia Championship on Wednesday, April 9. Sindhu defeated Ester Wardoyo of Indonesia in straight sets to make it to the next round.

Djokovic crashes out of Monte Carlo masters after 2nd straight loss to TabiloNovak Djokovic crashed out of the Monte Carlo Masters following a 3-6, 4-6 loss against unseeded Alejandro Tabilo in the second round on Wednesday. Following his win, Tabilo maintained a remarkable 100% win record over Djokovic.

GT vs RR: Rajasthan skipper Samson defends decision to bowl first in AhmedabadRajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson defended the decision to bowl first in Ahmedabad after their loss to Gujarat Titans on Wednesday, April 9. RR lost their third game in the IPL 2025 season.

IPL 2025 GT vs RR: All-round Gujarat Titans hammer Rajasthan Royals to top tableGujarat Titans (GT) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), beating Rajasthan Royals (RR) by 58 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Sai Sudharsan was the star of the show with his magnificent innings of 82 (53) while Prasidh Krishna emerged as the pick of the bowlers.

Compound archery added to Olympics 2028: Why it's a big boost to India's hopesThe Los Angeles Olympics in 2028 will feature the mixed team compound archery event in addition to the five recurve events. For the first time since the reintroduction of archery in 1972 in the Olympics, a new bow style has been added to the Games.

GT vs RR: Riyan Parag smashes bat in anger following controversial dismissalRiyan Parag was left fuming and smashed his bat in anger after being dismissed in controversial fashion against Gujarat Titans on April 9. Riyan was dismissed for 26 runs during the tough run chase against GT.

Watch: Yashasvi Jaiswal's spectacular catch ruins Rashid Khan's 'no-look' shotRajastha Royals batter Yashasvi Jaiswal took a stunning diving catch to dismiss Rashid Khan during Match 23 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Gujarat Titans.

We've upper hand over DC, they're only relying on 3 players: Jitesh SharmaRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) wicketkeeper batter feels his team has the upper hand over Delhi Capitals (DC) in their upcoming clash at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru as they're not dependent on only three players like DC.

IPL 2025 GT vs RR: All-round Gujarat Titans hammer Rajasthan Royals to top tableGujarat Titans (GT) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), beating Rajasthan Royals (RR) by 58 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Sai Sudharsan was the star of the show with his magnificent innings of 82 (53) while Prasidh Krishna emerged as the pick of the bowlers.

Compound archery added to Olympics 2028: Why it's a big boost to India's hopesThe Los Angeles Olympics in 2028 will feature the mixed team compound archery event in addition to the five recurve events. For the first time since the reintroduction of archery in 1972 in the Olympics, a new bow style has been added to the Games.

GT vs RR: Riyan Parag smashes bat in anger following controversial dismissalRiyan Parag was left fuming and smashed his bat in anger after being dismissed in controversial fashion against Gujarat Titans on April 9. Riyan was dismissed for 26 runs during the tough run chase against GT.

Watch: Yashasvi Jaiswal's spectacular catch ruins Rashid Khan's 'no-look' shotRajastha Royals batter Yashasvi Jaiswal took a stunning diving catch to dismiss Rashid Khan during Match 23 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Gujarat Titans.

We've upper hand over DC, they're only relying on 3 players: Jitesh SharmaRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) wicketkeeper batter feels his team has the upper hand over Delhi Capitals (DC) in their upcoming clash at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru as they're not dependent on only three players like DC.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
